page.title: 01General Description
page.content: {This is a rural, agricultural, {undulating, wooded area, the main {settlement being Shorwell-old but with {new private and council houses. There {are smaller settlements; Yafford, {Kingston and Limerstone. It is on S.W. {coast of the Island bounded on the {south by the Military coast road and {on the north by the B3323-the {Newport-Shorwell-Brighstone road. The {north part of the D block contains the {lower slopes of the Downs. The area {contains 4 manor houses and a tourist {attraction-one of the 2 working water {mills on the Island (Yafford). A {modern amenity is the TV broadcasting {mast at Chillerton Down. The area {contains an Anglican and a Methodist {church in Shorwell and an Anglican {church at Kingston. The are some {disused chalk pits in the area. There {is an inn at Shorwell.
